meanings.sent1: She will consign the package to the courier for delivery.
meanings.sent2: Please consign the letter to the mailbox for me.
meanings.sent3: He consigned the keys to the new owner with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility was consigned to her capable hands.
meanings.sent5: The teacher consigned the homework to the students' desks.

meanings.sent1: They consign the task to the most experienced team member.
meanings.sent2: I will consign this project to you for completion.
meanings.sent3: The detective consigned the case to his partner for further investigation.
meanings.sent4: She consigned her loyalty to the cause without hesitation.
meanings.sent5: The captain consigned the duty to the first mate.

meanings.definition: To send or address for sale or disposal
meanings.sent1: They consign their old clothes to the thrift store.
meanings.sent2: We consign these items to the auction house for sale.
meanings.sent3: He consigned the broken toys to the trash bin.
meanings.sent4: The company consigned the surplus inventory for quick disposal.
meanings.sent5: She consigned the antique vase to the antique shop for sale.
